title: H2 storage - are H atoms oxidized or reduced

content.description:
Li3N(s) + 2 H2(g) ⇄ LiNH2(s) + 2 LiH(s) 
ΔH° = -192 kJ/molrxn 
Because pure H2 is a hazardous substance, safer and more cost effective techniques to store it as a solid for shipping purposes have been developed. One such method is the reaction represented above, which occurs at 200°C.
content.question: Which of the following happens to H atoms in the forward reaction?

choices.label: H atoms are both oxidized and reduced.
H atoms are neither oxidized nor reduced.

content.answer: H atoms are both oxidized and reduced.
